column4: ok, please help, how do I change permissions of a file or folder from root to me
chown me:me file
I'm very new to this, please explain?
are you at the command line where the file is?
or are you using a file manager
the file is on my desktop
ok, so I type sudo chown ashnickel: and then the file name? so ashnickel/desktop/hplip?
sudo chown ashnickel:ashnickel ashnickel/desktop/hplip
or... sudo chown ashnickel:ashnickel ~/desktop/hplip ... if that doesn't work
it didn't work, either way, whether capitalized or not   error:   ashnickel@dell:~$ sudo chown ashnickel:ashnickel/desktop/hplip-2.7.6
try running gksu nautilus
where do i find that?
once that is running, browse to the file , right-click and go to properties, then the permissions tab; should be able to change it from there
hit Alt-F2 and type it in there
i have tried all things, and the gknu nautilus doesn't even show me the file
how do you know it is there?
is it on your desktop?
try the gksu nautilus thing and navigate to File System/home/ashnickel/Desktop
ok, let me try that
thank you. that unlocked it for me
no problem
